author: The Editorial Board
title: Cleaning Up After Richard Cordray
text:
Mick Mulvaney has been doing yeoman’s work cleaning up after Richard Cordray at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. One mess he may have overlooked is the bureau’s dubious lawsuit against student-loan servicer Navient.
Mr. Cordray spent four years scouring every nook and cranny of Navient’s business. Navient produced 450,000 pages of documents, hundreds of hours of phone recordings and more than 30 written reports. Two days before President Obama left office, Mr. Cordray sued Navient for “systematically and illegally...
